Reviews.Title: “Fine **hotel, just fine!”
Reviews.Author: Vanya2012
Reviews.Content: Last week (2nd week of April 2012), we've spend three days in this ** hotel. After reading the reviews on this page we were a bit worried about a lot of things. It even made me have doubts about if I wanted to stay here and not just go to a different place. On arrival there were two very nice English man. No their Englsh wasn't the best but they were very friendly and helpfull. After signing us into the big book they explained us the 'houserules'. We've been reading about these in the reviews as well. - Leaving roomkey when leaving the hotel - Receptiondesk closed from 1 - 6. Which means you have to be back in the hotel before 1 or stay out untill 6. - Breakfast is 5 euro per person per day - Lugageroom 10 euro per room When you know these things in advance.... No problem at all. (at least not for us) We were assigned to a room on the third floor. We took the stairs because the elevator is a bit shabby. (actually I'm just a easilly scared person ;-)) After arriving in our room, we were happily surprised. The room was pretty big and looked clean. We got a double bed, closet and our own bathroom with toilet, shower etc. It overlooked the streetside and therefor it was a noisy room. So. If you're looking for a cheap hotel, close to the trainstation (50m), shops and restaurant and about a 20min. walk to the old Rome.... This is the right place. Rome is a busy place with many many tourists. Even an expansive hotel will be noisy. For the two stars and cheap price this is a lovely place to stay! To reply to the things I've been reading here: - we didn't leave any of our money/passport etc in our room and just took it with us. So no robbery here - yes, the station area is pretty dodgy but I didn't feel unsafe for a second because of all the tourists (so no worries there) - the beds are really just fine! Clean, big, and no noise (at least not in our room) - the bathroom was fine and since it was in our room it was clean but just fine. (no smelly pipes) - no unfriendly staff. Just be nice to them and they'll be nice to you! Just.... enjoy Rome. Don't expact a 300 euro room and you'll be happily surprised!

Reviews.Title: “good for a couple of nights, if you need to use public transport”
Reviews.Author: Marin81
Reviews.Content: this hotel is OK, if you are staying for 1 nights or 2. very very close to the train station. plenty of bars and shops around. cleanliness is acceptable, but bathroom very small, and a bit smelly due to pipes. beds are very unconfortable, and very noisy. however, for the price we payed (40 EUR night) was more than OK.

Reviews.Title: “Vanishing Money”
Reviews.Author: Raychel S
Reviews.Content: it was hotel policy that keys are handed into reception before you went out so we always did so that the cleaner could clean the room, I had left our money in the suit case for safety in the room and we went out for our day trip. When we had come back it was all gone we went down to reception to rport this as they had they key all day, the Manager dismissed me and told me that this sort of thing does not happen in our hotel, I explained that it had done and asked how he could help me again he told me that this had not happened and to go away, I told the manager that I was going to call the police he said as you have not declared anything valuble in the room to me the police cannot do anything, so we went out of the hotel to go to the police station and the Manager followed us shouting abuse to us this left us feeling so uncomftable

Reviews.Title: “Keep a close eye on you valuables if staying here!”
Reviews.Author: Guest i
Reviews.Content: Money vanishes miraclously at this place. Be prepared that your belongings get searched through really properly. Staff is rude, insolent and seems not to understand English in the case of complaints. The last night of our stay I noticed that one hundred Euro were taken from a little case keeped in the back of the drawer of the nighttable. It was was obvious that someone searched my belongings since all things were reorganized. I went to the manager, who played the incident down and told me to check my things thoroughly again - then I might find it. He did not take the matter seriously and talked down to me. However, I agreed to check the room again and told him to come back to him, whatsoever. Clearly the money turned not up and when I came back to him the next morning he became rude, insolent and seemed not to understand English anymore. Absolutely not recommendable.

Reviews.Title: “WHAT YOU SEE IS WHAT YOU GET! EXCELLENT FOR CITY HOPPERS AND STUDENTS”
Reviews.Author: Faustocoppi1953
Reviews.Content: At first I had my doubts after booking, seeing that I d had to be in at 01u00! Termini area I m acquinted with since I slept there over 30 times! This hotel was the cheapest ever, I got a clean room, and a clean bathroom, friendly receptionist, and hey I had to pay 10 euro per room to store our luggage the last day but I knew this in advance! Breakfast I didnt even try, since there is no hotel in this area wich offers a propper breakfast at this cheap rates in the whole area! I paid 25 euro per person, and yes there was no rembrandt hanging on the wall, no thermal bath, no superview, but I got to visit Rome, slept in a good and clean bed, enjoyed the cafés in the neighboorhood and had some good talks with the owner!!!! I was happy and satisfied!!

Reviews.Title: “IT'S BASIC, BUT A GREAT BASE TO SEE THE SIGHTS”
Reviews.Author: INCE1971
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as it was the cheapest I could find. We had an ensuite room which was clean and functional. It was very noisy at night as it overlooked the road but we were so knackered from sightseeing it didn't matter. The staff were always helpful and polite. You could have air con, but it was 10 euros a night, so we didn't bother. Didn't use any other facilities. I booked this hotel as it was next to the train station ( with all the usual dodgy characters around, which mean't the entertainment was free watching from our window. didn't feel in danger walking around there as there were so many tourists), so it was easy to get about using the metro and buses. if you want luxury , you won't find it herer, but if you want a base in which to explore the beautiful city of Rome, it was a bargain.....clean and comfortable. Weekend including flights and accommodation for 4 days was £300 for the 2 of us!! It does what it says on the tin!! You get what you pay for!!

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY FROM THIS HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: jugoan
Reviews.Content: Awful reception. Personnel was rude and unfriendly.....and not clean. I was helping a friend bring the luggage up to the room and was denied access! The so called hotel seemed more like a meeting place for prostitutes....AND it is not in the historical center of Rome, it is 50 meters from the train station.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel ever ..... people, stay the hell away !!!”
Reviews.Author: RomeVisitor2010
Reviews.Content: Rude, unhelpful staff that threatened to call the Police if we did not pay the full rate upfront ... This is one hotel you do not want to stay in !!!

Reviews.Title: “Danger Will Robinson!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: JaynePfingst
Reviews.Content: We arrived, and in our usual jovial Australian enthusiasm, despite the scum we had to walk past to get to reception, announced we were checking in for 4 nights! "No English" was the reply, and with folded arms he stared at us blankly. This was the beginning of the nightmare... Don't use the phone they charged my friend in excess of 100euros for calls that didn't even connect! They wouldn't give us our room key until the phone was paid. You are not allowed to have a room key when you leave to site see, so your personal belongings are always accessible to staff. I have absolutely nothing positive to say about this place. Oh that is a lie - We weren't raped and killed!!!! Believe the bad reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Oh dear......”
Reviews.Author: grenners
Reviews.Content: If you just wanted a bed for the night this would be fine. On the other hand, if you just wanted a bed for the night you could expose yourself to a policeman, get a much better bed for the night (in the Police Station), a much better breakfast and, all in all, it would probably be cheaper. There is nothing to recommend this hotel.....

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Marechiaro
HotelInfo.Address: Via Gioberti 30, Rome, Italy
